exp
Returns the exponent value (
e
number) to the specified power
The "e" number is 2.71828182845904, and it is the base of the natural log.
The "exp" function is the opposite of the "ln" function, which returns the natural log of a given number.
Syntax
exp
(arg)
Setting
Purpose
arg
The exponent applied to the base
e
.
The return value is a decimal number.
Note
The function is called using the
button, located in the Algorithm Editor on the "Arithmetic and boolean" tab.
